Annotation.note:
Let $A$ and $B$ be the two common points of two circles $(O)$ and $(P)$. Through $A$ a line is drawn meeting the circles at $C$ and $D$ respectively. $G$ is the midpoint of $CD$. Line $BG$ intersects circles $(O)$ and $(P)$ at $E$ and $F$, respectively. Show that $G$ is the midpoint of $F$ and $E$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
